main event: A round, basketball-sized object with colored lights and slow spiraling motion was observed in Oklahoma City on January 9th, 1959.
interesting points: The observation lasted 2-3 minutes and was made through 6 x 50 binoculars with a filter, making it impossible to see the details clearly.
The conclusion listed possibilities including it being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object, with insufficient data for evaluation.
The observer reported slow spiraling motion and the object being in motion while looking at the sun through a welding helmet with size 9 filter.
The observer was an electronic technician at a refinery in Oklahoma City, and the observation took place from sunrise to sunset.
Two pictures were reportedly taken, and the weather was described as clear with light haze.
sighted object: round, basketball-sized object with colored lights
